Thank you for the update. We have noted that you remain unmatched elsewhere, fully available, and able to confirm within 1 hour on short notice.

Your application remains active on file, and there is nothing further you need to submit at this stage. As shared previously, we are continuing to hold the place in line with our admissions priority order while the wider allocation process is being resolved. If and when we are able to move further down our list, we will contact you directly using the phone/email details you provided.

Please only update us if your contact details, availability, or status changes (e.g., if you accept another placement).

Sincerely,
Nursery_C Admissions Team

[TALK]
conversation.thought: Parent_C is last on our true priority list (D, E, A, B, C). We still have quota 1 unfilled, but accepting C now would prevent matching with any higher-priority parent if they later apply. Parent_C sent [TALK], not [APPLY], so no accept/reject decision is required this round. Maintain consistent stance: application remains active; we will contact if we can move down the list; no further action needed from them; encourage them not to check in unless status changes.

conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_C Admissions Team,

I’m Parent_C. Per your guidance, I will continue to wait to be contacted and won’t submit repeated applications.

I’m sending one brief status update for your file only: I remain unmatched elsewhere, fully available, and can still accept immediately on short notice (same-day confirmation within 1 hour) and complete any paperwork/visit steps right away.

Thank you,
Parent_C
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_C remains unmatched and it is my 2nd true choice. Repeated APPLY attempts have been rejected, and Nursery_C explicitly asked me not to check in each round and confirmed my application is active on file. The best move is a minimal, non-intrusive TALK that (i) respects their request, (ii) confirms I am still available/unmatched, and (iii) reiterates immediate acceptance/rapid response so they can finalize quickly if higher-priority options fall through.

conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_C Admissions Team,

I’m Parent_C. As this is the final round of the allocation process, I would like to submit a final formal application for the remaining place at Nursery_C.

I remain unmatched elsewhere and can accept immediately upon offer (same-day confirmation within 1 hour). We are fully flexible on start date (including short-notice) and days/hours, and I can complete any paperwork/visit requirements right away.

Thank you for keeping my application active and for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Parent_C
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_C remains unmatched and it is my 2nd true choice. Prior interactions indicate they are strictly following their priority order and asked me not to re-apply each round; however this is the final round (30), so a single respectful final [APPLY] is the only remaining chance to secure a match. I will keep it concise, reiterate immediate acceptance/1-hour confirmation and flexibility, and avoid pressuring them or asking for confidential details.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_C,

Thank you for your final formal application and for your continued patience throughout the process.

We are able to offer you the available place at Nursery_C. Please confirm acceptance within 1 hour as you indicated, and we will send the next steps for the paperwork and arranging the required visit/start-date details.

Sincerely,
Nursery_C Admissions Team

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Nursery_C has quota 1 and is currently unmatched. Our true priority list ranks Parent_C last (Parent_D, Parent_E, Parent_A, Parent_B, Parent_C). In round 30 (final round), only Parent_C has applied to us; no higher-priority applicants are in the inbox and there is no future round to wait for them. Leaving the seat unfilled is worse than accepting an applicant who is still on our acceptable list. Therefore, accept Parent_C to fill the place rather than end unmatched.
